column1: For each stratum for each multi-performance rate measure, fill out columns A-H. For example, if measure #001 has 3 performance strata, there should be three rows filled out, one for each performance strata

column3: short Stratum description
column4: long stratum description

column3: LVEF prescribed beta-blocker therapy
column4: Percentage of patients with a diagnosis of CAD or history of cardiac surgery who have a current or prior LVEF < 40% who were prescribed beta-blocker therapy

column3: Prior MI prescribed beta-blocker therapy
column4: Percentage of patients with a diagnosis of CAD or history of cardiac surgery who have a prior (within the past 3 years) myocardial infarction who were prescribed beta-blocker therapy

column3: Med Rec 18 - 64 years and older
column4: Medication Reconciliation Post-Discharge: 18-64 years of age

column3: Med Rec 65 years and older
column4: Medication Reconciliation Post-Discharge: 65 years and older

column3: Med Rec all patients 18 years and older
column4: Medication Reconciliation Post-Discharge:All patients 18 years of age and older

column3: Visits with blood pressure results < 140/90 mmHg
column4: Percentage of patient visits with blood pressure results < 140/90 mmHg

column3: Visits with blood pressure results ³ 140/90 mmHg and plan of care
column4: Percentage of patient visits with blood pressure results ³ 140/90 mmHg and plan of care

column3: Overall visits with blood pressure results < 140/90 mmHg and ³ 140/90 mmHg with a documented plan of care
column4: Overall percentage of patient visits with blood pressure results < 140/90 mmHg and ³ 140/90 mmHg with a documented plan of care

column3: Patients screened for tobacco use one or more times
column4: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older who were screened for tobacco use one or more times within 24 months

column3: Screened for tobacco, identified as tobacco user that received cessation.
column4: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older who were screened for tobacco use and identified as a tobacco user who received tobacco cessation intervention

column3: Patients screened for tobacco use one or more times and received cessation
column4: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older who were screened for tobacco use one or more times within 24 months AND who received tobacco cessation intervention if identified as a tobacco user

column3: Ordered at least one high-risk
column4: Percentage of patients who were ordered at least one high-risk medication

column3: Ordered at least two high-risk
column4: Percentage of patients who were ordered at least two of the same high-risk medication

column3: Implantable Cardioverter-Defibrillator complications or mortality at 30 days
column4: Complications or mortality at 30 days

column3: Implantable Cardioverter-Defibrillator complications at 90 day
column4: Complications at 90 days

column3: Discharges received follow up 30 days
column4: The percentage of discharges for which the patient received follow-up within 30 days after discharge

column3: Discharges received follow up 7 days
column4: The percentage of discharges for which the patient received follow-up within 7 days after discharge

column3: Cardiac tamponade/pericardiocentesis females 18-64 years
column4: Females 18-64 years of age

column3: Cardiac tamponade/pericardiocentesis males 18-64 years
column4: Males 18-64 years of age

column3: Cardiac tamponade/pericardiocentesis females 65 years and older
column4: Females 65 years of age and older

column3: Cardiac tamponade/pericardiocentesis males 65 years and older
column4: Males 65 years of age and older

column3: Overall cardiac tamponade/pericardiocentesis female and males 18 years and older
column4: Overall percentage of patients with cardiac tamponade and/or pericardiocentesis occurring within 30 days

column3: One dose of meningococcal vaccine
column4: Patients who had one dose of meningococcal vaccine on or between the patientÕs 11th and 13th birthdays

column3: One tetanus, diphtheria toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine
column4: Patients who had one tetanus, diphtheria toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine (Tdap) on or between the patientÕs 10th and 13th birthdays

column3: Completed the HPV vaccine
column4: Patients who have completed the HPV vaccine with defferent dates of service on or between the patient's 9th and 13th birthdays

column3: Compliant for Meningococcal, Tdap and HPV
column4: All patients who are compliant for Meningococcal, Tdap and HPV during the specified timeframes

column3: 5-50 years well-controlled asthma, without elevated risk of exacerbation
column4: Overall Percentage for patients (aged 5-50 years) with well-controlled asthma, without elevated risk of exacerbation

column3: 5-17 years well-controlled asthma, without elevated risk of exacerbation
column4: Percentage of pediatric patients (aged 5-17 years) with well-controlled asthma, without elevated risk of exacerbation.

column3: 18-50 years well-controlled asthma, without elevated risk of exacerbation
column4: Percentage of adult patients (aged 18-50 years) with well-controlled asthma, without elevated risk of exacerbation

column3: 5 to 17 asthma well-controlled specified asthma control tool result
column4: Asthma well-controlled (submit the most recent specified asthma control tool result) for patients 5 to 17 with Asthma

column3: 18 to 50 asthma well-controlled specified asthma control tool result
column4: Asthma well-controlled (submit the most recent specified asthma control tool result) for patients 18 to 50 with Asthma

column3: 5 to 17 with asthma elevated risk of exacerbation
column4: Patient not at elevated risk of exacerbation for patients 5 to 17 with Asthma

column3: 18 to 50 with asthma elevated risk of exacerbation
column4: Patient not at elevated risk of exacerbation for patients 18 to 50 with Asthma

column3: Patients 18 years of age or older as of January 1 of the denominator identification period who had a lumbar discectomy/laminotomy procedure performed during the denominator identification period
column4: Percentage of patients 18 years of age or older as of January 1 of the denominator identification period who had a lumbar discectomy/laminotomy procedure performed during the denominator identification period and whose back pain was measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) within three months preoperatively AND three months (6 - 20 weeks) postoperatively.

column3: Average of the change in pain preoperatively to post-operatively among patients having received a lumbar discectomy/laminotomy procedure.
column4: Average change (preoperative to three months (6 - 20 weeks) postoperative) in back pain for all eligible patients 18 years of age or older as of January 1 of the denominator identification period who had a lumbar discectomy/laminotomy procedure performed during the denominator identification period and whose back pain was measured by the visual analog scale (vas) within three months preoperatively and at three months (6 - 20 weeks) postoperatively

column3: Patients 18 years of age or older as of January 1 of the denominator identification period who had a lumbar spine fusion procedure performed during the denominator identification period
column4:
Percentage of patients 18 years of age or older as of October 1 of the denominator identification
period who had a lumbar spine fusion procedure performed during the denominator identification period and whose back pain was measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) within three months preoperatively AND at one year (+/- 3 months) postoperatively.

column3: Average of the change in pain preoperatively to post-operatively among patients having received a lumbar fusion.
column4: Average change (preoperative to one year postoperative) in back pain for all eligible patients 18 years of age or older as of October 1 of the denominator identification period who had a lumbar spine fusion procedure performed during the denominator identification period and whose back pain was measured by the visual analog scale (vas) within three months preoperatively and at one year (+/- 3 months) postoperatively

column3: Patients 18 years of age or older as of January 1 of the denominator identification period who had a lumbar discectomy/laminotomy procedure performed during the denominator identification period.
column4:
Percentage of patients 18 years of age or older as of January 1 of the denominator identification
period who had a lumbar discectomy/laminotomy procedure performed during the denominator identification period and whose leg pain was measured by the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) within three months preoperatively AND at three months (6 to 20 weeks) postoperatively.

column3: Average of the change in pain preoperatively to postoperatively among patients having received a lumbar discectomy/laminotomy.
column4: Average change (preoperative to three months (6 to 20 weeks) postoperative) in leg pain for all eligible patients 18 years of age or older as of January 1 of the denominator identification period who had a lumbar discectomy/laminectomy procedure performed during the denominator identification period and whose leg pain was measured by the visual analog scale (vas) within three months preoperatively and at three months (6 to 20 weeks) postoperatively

column3: Birth to 1 year of age) who were screened for risk of developmental, behavioral and social delays using a standardized tool
column4: Children in the eligible population who turned 1 during the performance period. (Birth to 1 year of age) who were screened for risk of developmental, behavioral and social delays using a standardized tool with interpretation and report within 12 months preceding or on their birthday

column3: Children >1 to 2 who were screened for risk of developmental, behavioral and social delays using a standardized tool
column4: Children in the eligible population who turned 2 during the performance period (> 1 year to 2 years of age) who were screened for risk of developmental, behavioral and social delays using a standardized tool with interpretation and report within 12 months preceding or on their birthday

column3: Children >2 to 3 who were screened for risk of developmental, behavioral and social delays using a standardized tool
column4: Children in the eligible population who turned 3 during the performance period ( > 2 years to 3 years of age) who were screened for risk of developmental, behavioral and social delays using a standardized tool with interpretation and report within 12 months preceding or on their birthday

column3: All children 1, 2, or 3 who were screened for risk of developmental, behavioral and social delays using a standardized tool
column4: All children who turned 1, 2, or 3 during the performance period who were screened for risk of developmental, behavioral and social delays using a standardized tool with interpretation and report within 12 months preceding or on their birthday
